intro: Coffea vaughanii, commonly known as the Ethiopian coffee tree, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the highlands of Ethiopia and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, white flowers. The plant produces red berries containing two seeds, which are used to make coffee. It thrives in tropical climates with high altitudes and well-drained soil. Due to its unique flavor profile, it is considered a rare and valuable species in the coffee industry.
